page.title: 03Interview with the Vicar
page.content: We went to interview the Vicar of St. Mary's church. Here is some of the information he gave us about the church. Although he did not know how old the church was, Rev. Goodwins said that there is evidence of Christian worship on the site since 900AD. The first record of a church on the site was in 1186. The oldest gravestone in the churchyard is dated 1724. Each year approximately 50 people are married in the church and about 6 people are buried there. There are six bells in the tower, but the vicar would like two more as it would make a more pleasant sound. The stocks by the entrance to the church were made about 200 years ago and are big enough for three people to be locked up in them.
